availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph Coleman Carter (Woodford County, Kentucky, physician and politician)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, physician and politician. Virginia native. Married to Margaret Carlyle Carter. Father of Drake Daniel Carter, Mary Ella Carter, Lewis Marshall Carter, Dolly Carter, Josephine D. Carter, and Thomas Charles Carter. Physician in Woodford County, Kentucky, in 1850. Employed John Lawson as a laborer in Woodford County in 1850. Owned twenty enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1850. Physician in Woodford County in 1860. Owned twelve enslaved persons in Woodford County in 1860. Member of the Versailles Board of Trustees in Woodford County in 1861.

ab.bibl:

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles p. 526A.
